args.natural_language_statement: Let K be a field, V a finite-dimensional vector space over K. Let S and T be linear endomorphisms of V. Suppose there is a basis of V consisting of eigenvectors of T, and that S has the same eigenvectors (possibly with different eigenvalues). Prove that S and T commute: S ∘ T = T ∘ S. Translate this statement to Lean4 and end the theorem with := by sorry.

{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open LinearMap
open Submodule in
open Submodule in

/-- Suppose that $T \in \mathcal{L}(V)$ has $\operatorname{dim} V$ distinct eigenvalues and that $S \in \mathcal{L}(V)$ has the same eigenvectors as $T$ (not necessarily with the same eigenvalues). Prove that $S T=T S$. -/
theorem comm_of_eigenvectors_eq [CommRing R] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M]
 {T S : LinearMap R M} {v : M} : S.eigenvectors v = T.eigenvectors v → S ∘ₗ T = T ∘ₗ S :=

args.content:
import Mathlib

open LinearMap

variable {K : Type*} [Field K]
variable {V : Type*} [AddCommGroup V] [Module K V] [FiniteDimensional K V]

/-- Exercise: Suppose T : V →ₗ[K] V has a basis of eigenvectors, and S : V →ₗ[K] V has the same eigenvectors (possibly with different eigenvalues). Then S and T commute. -/
theorem Axler_exercise_5_20 {ι : Type*} [Fintype ι] (b : Basis ι K V) (T S : V →ₗ[K] V)
  (μ λ : ι → K)
  (hT : ∀ i, T (b i) = μ i • b i)
  (hS : ∀ i, S (b i) = λ i • b i) : S.comp T = T.comp S := by sorry
